meanings.definition: A substance that causes drunkenness or intoxication.
meanings.sent1: The strong intoxicant made him feel dizzy and confused.
meanings.sent2: She avoided consuming any intoxicant before driving.
meanings.sent3: The party punch was such a potent intoxicant that everyone danced all night.
meanings.sent4: The music acted as an intoxicant, lifting their spirits to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The bartender warned about the dangerous effects of the intoxicant.

meanings.sent1: The thrilling roller coaster ride was an exhilarating intoxicant for the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was a delightful intoxicant for the children.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie served as a surprising intoxicant for the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter acted as an intoxicant, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop was a natural intoxicant for the hikers.
